reapack.name: Retro Codec Suite (TLM)
reapack.desc: Vintage gaming console audio compression emulation

metadata.description:
{\rtf1\ansi {\fonttbl\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Tahoma;} {\colortbl;\red0\green0\blue0;} \f0\fs16 Authentic emulation of vintage gaming console audio compression formats. Transform your audio with the signature sound of classic gaming hardware.
Features: • 5 Codec Types: N64 VADPCM, IMA ADPCM, 4-bit PCM, PSX ADPCM, Apple 1-bit • Continuous sample rates from 8kHz to project rate with Shift+drag fine control • Continuous bit depths from 1 to 16 bits with Shift+drag fine control • Authentic codec tables for period-accurate emulation • Musical artifacts scaling with exponential response curve • Saturation, artifacts intensity, dry/wet mix, and output gain controls • Optional anti-aliasing pre-filter and lo-fi character filter • Professional GUI with visual feedback and fine control options
Codec Types: • N64 VADPCM - Nintendo 64's Vector-Adaptive Differential PCM with authentic predictor tables • IMA ADPCM - Interactive Multimedia Association standard with 89-value step table • 4-bit PCM - Aggressive lo-fi digital artifacts • PSX ADPCM - PlayStation 1's format with authentic filter coefficients • Apple 1-bit - Classic Macintosh delta-sigma modulation
Controls: • Codec Type - Select compression format • Sample Rate - 8kHz to project rate (Shift+drag for continuous, notches at 8k, 11k, 16k, 22k, 32k, 44k, Project) • Bit Depth - 1 to 16 bits (Shift+drag for continuous, notches at 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16) • Saturation - Soft saturation for harmonic warmth • Artifacts - Musical control over compression artifact intensity • Mix - Blend processed and dry signals • Output - Master output level (±12dB range, 0dB default) • Anti-Aliasing - Pre-filter to reduce aliasing • Lo-Fi Filter - Character filter matching target sample rate
Fine Control: • Hold Shift while dragging Sample Rate or Bit Depth for intermediate values • Double-click any slider to reset to default • Visual feedback shows when fine control is active (orange highlighting)
Perfect for chiptune music, lo-fi beats, retro game soundtracks, and experimental sound design. }

version.author: Thomas LeRoy Meier
version.changelog: v7.1 - Initial Release • 4 authentic codec emulations: N64 VADPCM, IMA ADPCM, 4-bit PCM, PSX ADPCM • Period-accurate sample rates (11-44kHz) and bit depths (4-24 bit) • Stable artifact processing with normalized gain coefficients • Professional custom GUI with dropdown codec selector • Visual feedback with stepped sliders for sample rate and bit depth • Double-click any slider to reset to default value • Optional anti-aliasing and lo-fi filters for authentic retro character • Output defaults to 0dB with ±12dB range for gain staging • CPU-efficient real-time processing with parameter smoothing

version.author: Thomas LeRoy Meier
version.changelog: v8.1 - Major Update: Fine Control & Apple 1-bit • NEW: Apple 1-bit codec - Classic Macintosh delta-sigma modulation • NEW: Shift+drag fine control for continuous sample rate and bit depth values • NEW: Sample rate now extends to project rate (not limited to 48kHz) • NEW: Authentic codec tables for all formats: - N64 VADPCM predictor coefficient table - IMA ADPCM 89-value step size table with index adjustments - PSX ADPCM filter coefficient presets • IMPROVED: Musical artifacts scaling with exponential response (pow 2.5 curve) - Subtle compression at low values (5-10%) - Progressive effect throughout entire range - Per-codec optimization for authentic character • IMPROVED: Bit depth range now 1-16 bits (removed 24-bit, added 1-bit and 2-bit) • IMPROVED: Sample rate presets: 8k, 11k, 16k, 22k, 32k, 44k, Project Rate • FIXED: Display values now correctly show at notch positions • FIXED: Apple 1-bit stability (no more feedback/screaming) • ENHANCED: Visual feedback - sliders turn orange during fine control • ENHANCED: Control hints between sliders show Shift+drag option • IMPROVED: Better default positions (44.1kHz, 8-bit)

metadata.description:
{\rtf1\ansi {\fonttbl\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Tahoma;} {\colortbl;\red0\green0\blue0;} \f0\fs16 A multi-tap delay plugin featuring creative, musical, and organically-inspired algorithms to produce 12 unique delay timings.
Features: • 12-tap delay matrix with individual control over each tap • 8 unique timing algorithms inspired by nature, music theory, and mathematics • Per-tap volume and pan controls with visual envelope editing • Intuitive grid-based interface • Enhanced feedback range with organic "jungle" character processing • Anti-aliased harmonic generation for clean high-frequency response
Algorithms: • Seed Random - Generates unpredictable, organic delay patterns • Quantum Shuffle - Timing variations based on quantum probability concepts • Perlin Noise - Smooth, natural variations using noise algorithms • Spiral Wave - Creates spiraling, evolving delay patterns • Chromatic - Delays based on chromatic scale intervals • Harmonic - Musically-consonant delays following harmonic series • Fibonacci - Nature-inspired timing using the golden ratio • L-System - Fractal-based patterns for complex rhythms (used to model plant growth)
Controls: • Click any square to enable/disable individual taps • Click VOL/PAN controls to adjust • Shift-click to enable/disable modulation • Ctrl-click to reset to default • Click and drag to draw envelopes }

version.author: Thomas LeRoy Meier
version.changelog: v1.1 - Enhanced Feedback & Jungle Aesthetics • Extended feedback range for more musical buildup without runaway • Added organic "jungle" character processing with frequency-balanced harmonics • Improved anti-aliasing protection prevents digital artifacts • Enhanced high-frequency damping eliminates squealing at high feedback • Subtle sub-harmonic generation adds rich low-end character above 90% • More stable feedback scaling across all tap configurations • Refined S-curve mapping provides better control in upper feedback ranges (75-100%) • Gentle musical enhancement that emerges progressively with feedback level • Maintains all original sweet spots while expanding creative possibilities

{\rtf1\ansi {\fonttbl\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Tahoma;} {\colortbl;\red0\green0\blue0;} \f0\fs16 A timing measurement plugin for REAPER that helps you set delays and time-based effects "by hand" using your mouse or keyboard.
Features: • Measures intervals between clicks with millisecond accuracy • Real-time conversion to Hz, ms, and samples at current sample rate • Tempo-aware beat division calculations • Audio click feedback for rhythmic accuracy • History tracking of recent measurements • Both mouse and MIDI input modes
Use Cases: • Setting delay times by tapping along with music • Finding the tempo of audio material • Calculating LFO rates and modulation speeds • Measuring rhythmic intervals for precise timing
Usage: 1. Choose input mode (Mouse or MIDI) 2. Click the main button or play MIDI notes to mark timing points 3. View instant conversion to useful time formats 4. Use measurements to dial in delay times }
